verses.verse: הֹד֣וּ <S%H3034><s%> ho-Du O give thanks לַיהוָ֣ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh unto the LORD כִּי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- for ט֑וֹב <S%H2896><s%> Tov; for [he is] good כִּ֖י <S%H3588><s%> ki for לְעוֹלָ֣ם <S%H5769><s%> le-'o-Lam [endureth] for ever חַסְדּֽוֹ׃ <S%H2617><s%> chas-Do. for his mercy

יֹ֭אמְרוּ <S%H559><s%> Yo-me-ru say גְּאוּלֵ֣י <S%H1350><s%> ge-'u-Lei Let the redeemed יְהוָ֑ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh; of the LORD אֲשֶׁ֥ר <S%H834><s%> 'a-Sher Whom גְּ֝אָלָ֗ם <S%H1350><s%> ge-'a-Lam, [so] whom he hath redeemed מִיַּד־ <S%H3027><s%> mi-yad- from the hand צָֽר׃ <S%H6862><s%> Tzar. of the enemy

וּֽמֵאֲרָצ֗וֹת <S%H776><s%> u-me-'a-ra-Tzot, them out of the lands קִ֫בְּצָ֥ם <S%H6908><s%> kib-be-Tzam And gathered מִמִּזְרָ֥ח <S%H4217><s%> mi-miz-Rach from the east וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב <S%H4628><s%> u-mi-ma-'a-Rav; and from the west מִצָּפ֥וֹן <S%H6828><s%> mitz-tza-Fon from the north וּמִיָּֽם׃ <S%H3220><s%> u-mi-Yam. and from the south

תָּע֣וּ <S%H8582><s%> ta-'U They wandered בַ֭מִּדְבָּר <S%H4057><s%> Vam-mid-bor in the wilderness בִּישִׁימ֣וֹן <S%H3452><s%> bi-shi-Mon in a solitary דָּ֑רֶךְ <S%H1870><s%> Da-rech; way עִ֥יר <S%H5892><s%> 'ir no city מ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב <S%H4186><s%> mo-Shav, to dwell לֹ֣א <S%H3808><s%> lo did not מָצָֽאוּ׃ <S%H4672><s%> ma-Tza-'u. they found

רְעֵבִ֥ים <S%H7457><s%> re-'e-Vim Hungry גַּם־ <S%H1571><s%> gam- again צְמֵאִ֑ים <S%H6771><s%> tze-me-'Im; and thirsty נַ֝פְשָׁ֗ם <S%H5315><s%> naf-Sham, their soul בָּהֶ֥ם ba-Hem תִּתְעַטָּֽף׃ <S%H5848><s%> tit-'at-Taf. fainted

וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ <S%H6817><s%> vai-yitz-'a-Ku Then they cried אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about יְ֭הוָה <S%H3069><s%> Yah-weh God בַּצַּ֣ר <S%H6862><s%> batz-Tzar in their trouble לָהֶ֑ם <S%H1992><s%> la-Hem; out מִ֝מְּצֽוּקוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם <S%H4691><s%> mi-me-tzu-ko-tei-Hem, them out of their distresses יַצִּילֵֽם׃ <S%H5337><s%> yatz-tzi-Lem. [and] he delivered

וַ֭יַּֽדְרִיכֵם <S%H1869><s%> Vai-yad-ri-chem And he led them forth בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ <S%H1870><s%> be-De-rech way יְשָׁרָ֑ה <S%H3477><s%> ye-sha-Rah; by the right לָ֝לֶ֗כֶת <S%H1980><s%> la-Le-chet, to go אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about עִ֥יר <S%H5892><s%> 'ir to a city מוֹשָֽׁב׃ <S%H4186><s%> mo-Shav. of habitation

יוֹד֣וּ <S%H3034><s%> yo-Du Oh that [men] would praise לַיהוָ֣ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh the LORD חַסְדּ֑וֹ <S%H2617><s%> chas-Do; [for] his goodness וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו <S%H6381><s%> ve-nif-le-'o-Tav, and [for] his wonderful works לִבְנֵ֥י <S%H1121><s%> liv-Nei to the children אָדָֽם׃ <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam. of men

כִּי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- for הִ֭שְׂבִּיעַ <S%H7646><s%> His-bi-a' For he satisfieth נֶ֣פֶשׁ <S%H5315><s%> Ne-fesh soul שֹׁקֵקָ֑ה <S%H8264><s%> sho-ke-Kah; the longing וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ <S%H5315><s%> ve-Ne-fesh soul רְ֝עֵבָה <S%H7457><s%> Re-'e-vah the hungry מִלֵּא־ <S%H4390><s%> mil-le- and filleth טֽוֹב׃ <S%H2896><s%> Tov. with goodness

יֹ֭שְׁבֵי <S%H3427><s%> Yo-she-vei Such as sit חֹ֣שֶׁךְ <S%H2822><s%> Cho-shech in darkness וְצַלְמָ֑וֶת <S%H6757><s%> ve-tzal-Ma-vet; and in the shadow of death אֲסִירֵ֖י <S%H615><s%> 'a-si-Rei [being] bound עֳנִ֣י <S%H6040><s%> 'o-Ni in affliction וּבַרְזֶֽל׃ <S%H1270><s%> u-var-Zel. and iron

כִּֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki- Because הִמְר֥וּ <S%H4784><s%> him-Ru Because they rebelled אִמְרֵי־ <S%H561><s%> 'im-rei- against the words אֵ֑ל <S%H410><s%> 'El; of God וַעֲצַ֖ת <S%H6098><s%> va-'a-Tzat the counsel עֶלְי֣וֹן <S%H5945><s%> el-Yon of the most High נָאָֽצוּ׃ <S%H5006><s%> na-'A-tzu. and contemned

וַיַּכְנַ֣ע <S%H3665><s%> vai-yach-Na' Therefore he brought down בֶּעָמָ֣ל <S%H5999><s%> be-'a-Mal with labour לִבָּ֑ם <S%H3820><s%> lib-Bam; their heart כָּ֝שְׁל֗וּ <S%H3782><s%> ka-she-Lu, they fell down וְאֵ֣ין <S%H369><s%> ve-'Ein and there עֹזֵֽר׃ <S%H5826><s%> 'o-Zer. and [there was] none to help

וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ <S%H2199><s%> vai-yiz-'a-Ku Then they cried אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about יְ֭הוָה <S%H3069><s%> Yah-weh God בַּצַּ֣ר <S%H6862><s%> batz-Tzar in their trouble לָהֶ֑ם <S%H1992><s%> la-Hem; out מִ֝מְּצֻֽקוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם <S%H4691><s%> mi-me-tzu-ko-tei-Hem, them out of their distresses יוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃ <S%H3467><s%> yo-shi-'Em. [and] he saved

יֽ֭וֹצִיאֵם <S%H3318><s%> Yo-tzi-'em He brought them out מֵחֹ֣שֶׁךְ <S%H2822><s%> me-Cho-shech of darkness וְצַלְמָ֑וֶת <S%H6757><s%> ve-tzal-Ma-vet; and the shadow of death וּמוֹסְר֖וֹתֵיהֶ֣ם <S%H4147><s%> u-mos-Ro-tei-Hem their bands יְנַתֵּֽק׃ <S%H5423><s%> ye-nat-Tek. in sunder

יוֹד֣וּ <S%H3034><s%> yo-Du Oh that [men] would praise לַיהוָ֣ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh the LORD חַסְדּ֑וֹ <S%H2617><s%> chas-Do; [for] his goodness וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו <S%H6381><s%> ve-nif-le-'o-Tav, and [for] his wonderful works לִבְנֵ֥י <S%H1121><s%> liv-Nei to the children אָדָֽם׃ <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam. of men

כִּֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> ki-Shi- for שִׁ֭בַּר <S%H7665><s%> bar For he hath broken דַּלְת֣וֹת <S%H1817><s%> dal-Tot the gates נְחֹ֑שֶׁת <S%H5178><s%> ne-Cho-shet; of brass וּבְרִיחֵ֖י <S%H1280><s%> u-ve-ri-Chei the bars בַרְזֶ֣ל <S%H1270><s%> var-Zel of iron גִּדֵּֽעַ׃ <S%H1438><s%> gid-De-a'. in sunder

אֱ֭וִלִים <S%H191><s%> 'E-vi-lim Fools מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ <S%H1870><s%> mid-De-rech because פִּשְׁעָ֑ם <S%H6588><s%> pish-'Am; of their transgression וּֽ֝מֵעֲוֹֽנֹתֵיהֶ֗ם <S%H5771><s%> u-me-'a-vo-no-tei-Hem, and because of their iniquities יִתְעַנּֽוּ׃ <S%H6031><s%> yit-'an-Nu. are afflicted

כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all אֹ֭כֶל <S%H400><s%> 'O-chel all manner of meat תְּתַעֵ֣ב <S%H8581><s%> te-ta-'Ev abhorreth נַפְשָׁ֑ם <S%H5315><s%> naf-Sham; Their soul וַ֝יַּגִּ֗יעוּ <S%H5060><s%> vai-yag-Gi-'u, and they draw near עַד־ <S%H5704><s%> 'ad- against שַׁ֥עֲרֵי <S%H8179><s%> Sha-'a-rei unto the gates מָֽוֶת׃ <S%H4194><s%> Ma-vet. of death

וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ <S%H2199><s%> vai-yiz-'a-Ku Then they cry אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about יְ֭הוָה <S%H3069><s%> Yah-weh God בַּצַּ֣ר <S%H6862><s%> batz-Tzar in their trouble לָהֶ֑ם <S%H1992><s%> la-Hem; out מִ֝מְּצֻֽקוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם <S%H4691><s%> mi-me-tzu-ko-tei-Hem, them out of their distresses יוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃ <S%H3467><s%> yo-shi-'Em. [and] he saveth

יִשְׁלַ֣ח <S%H7971><s%> yish-Lach He sent דְּ֭בָרוֹ <S%H1697><s%> de-va-ro his word וְיִרְפָּאֵ֑ם <S%H7495><s%> ve-yir-pa-'Em; and healed וִֽ֝ימַלֵּ֗ט <S%H4422><s%> vi-mal-Let, them and delivered מִשְּׁחִיתוֹתָֽם׃ <S%H7825><s%> mish-she-chi-to-Tam. [them] from their destructions ׆

יוֹד֣וּ <S%H3034><s%> yo-Du Oh that [men] would praise לַיהוָ֣ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh the LORD חַסְדּ֑וֹ <S%H2617><s%> chas-Do; [for] his goodness וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו <S%H6381><s%> ve-nif-le-'o-Tav, and [for] his wonderful works לִבְנֵ֥י <S%H1121><s%> liv-Nei to the children אָדָֽם׃ <S%H120><s%> a-Dam. of men ׆

וְ֭יִזְבְּחוּ <S%H2076><s%> Ve-yiz-be-chu And let them sacrifice זִבְחֵ֣י <S%H2077><s%> ziv-Chei the sacrifices תוֹדָ֑ה <S%H8426><s%> to-Dah; of thanksgiving וִֽיסַפְּר֖וּ <S%H5608><s%> vi-sap-pe-Ru and declare מַעֲשָׂ֣יו <S%H4639><s%> ma-'a-Sav his works בְּרִנָּֽה׃ <S%H7440><s%> be-rin-Nah. with rejoicing ׆

יוֹרְדֵ֣י <S%H3381><s%> yor-Dei They that go down הַ֭יָּם <S%H3220><s%> Hai-yom to the sea בָּאֳנִיּ֑וֹת <S%H591><s%> bo-'o-ni-Yot; in ships עֹשֵׂ֥י <S%H6213><s%> 'o-Sei that do מְ֝לָאכָ֗ה <S%H4399><s%> me-la-Chah, business בְּמַ֣יִם <S%H4325><s%> be-Ma-yim waters רַבִּֽים׃ <S%H7227><s%> rab-Bim. in great ׆

הֵ֣מָּה <S%H1992><s%> Hem-mah They רָ֭אוּ <S%H7200><s%> Ra-'u These see מַעֲשֵׂ֣י <S%H4639><s%> ma-'a-Sei the works יְהוָ֑ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh; of the LORD וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו <S%H6381><s%> ve-nif-le-'o-Tav, and his wonders בִּמְצוּלָֽה׃ <S%H4688><s%> bim-tzu-Lah. in the deep ׆

וַיֹּ֗אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer, For he commandeth וַֽ֭יַּעֲמֵד <S%H5975><s%> Vai-ya-'a-med and raiseth ר֣וּחַ <S%H7307><s%> Ru-ach wind סְעָרָ֑ה <S%H5591><s%> se-'a-Rah; the stormy וַתְּרוֹמֵ֥ם <S%H7311><s%> vat-te-ro-Mem which lifteth up גַּלָּֽיו׃ <S%H1530><s%> gal-Lav. the waves ׆

יַעֲל֣וּ <S%H5927><s%> ya-'a-Lu They mount up שָׁ֭מַיִם <S%H8064><s%> ma-yim to the heaven יֵרְד֣וּ <S%H3381><s%> ye-re-Du they go down תְהוֹמ֑וֹת <S%H8415><s%> te-ho-Mot; again to the depths נַ֝פְשָׁ֗ם <S%H5315><s%> naf-Sham, their soul בְּרָעָ֥ה <S%H7451><s%> be-ra-'Ah because of trouble תִתְמוֹגָֽג׃ <S%H4127><s%> tit-mo-Gag. is melted

יָח֣וֹגּוּ <S%H2287><s%> ya-Cho-gu They reel to and fro וְ֭יָנוּעוּ <S%H5128><s%> Ve-ya-nu-'u and stagger כַּשִּׁכּ֑וֹר <S%H7910><s%> kash-shik-Kor; like a drunken man וְכָל־ <S%H3605><s%> ve-chol and were at חָ֝כְמָתָ֗ם <S%H2451><s%> cha-che-ma-Tam, and are at their wits' תִּתְבַּלָּֽע׃ <S%H1104><s%> tit-bal-La'. end

וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ <S%H6817><s%> vai-yitz-'a-Ku Then they cry אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about יְ֭הוָה <S%H3069><s%> Yah-weh God בַּצַּ֣ר <S%H6862><s%> batz-Tzar in their trouble לָהֶ֑ם <S%H1992><s%> la-Hem; out וּֽ֝מִמְּצֽוּקֹתֵיהֶ֗ם <S%H4691><s%> u-mi-me-tzu-ko-tei-Hem, of their distresses יוֹצִיאֵֽם׃ <S%H3318><s%> yo-tzi-'Em. and he bringeth them out

יָקֵ֣ם <S%H6965><s%> ya-Kem He maketh סְ֭עָרָה <S%H5591><s%> Se-'a-rah the storm לִדְמָמָ֑ה <S%H1827><s%> lid-ma-Mah; a calm וַ֝יֶּחֱשׁ֗וּ <S%H2814><s%> vai-ye-che-Shu, thereof are still גַּלֵּיהֶֽם׃ <S%H1530><s%> gal-lei-Hem. so that the waves

וַיִּשְׂמְח֥וּ <S%H8055><s%> vai-yis-me-Chu Then are they glad כִֽי־ <S%H3588><s%> chi- because יִשְׁתֹּ֑קוּ <S%H8367><s%> yish-To-ku; because they be quiet וַ֝יַּנְחֵ֗ם <S%H5148><s%> vai-yan-Chem, so he bringeth אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about מְח֥וֹז <S%H4231><s%> me-Choz haven חֶפְצָֽם׃ <S%H2656><s%> chef-Tzam. them unto their desired

יוֹד֣וּ <S%H3034><s%> yo-Du Oh that [men] would praise לַיהוָ֣ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh the LORD חַסְדּ֑וֹ <S%H2617><s%> chas-Do; [for] his goodness וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו <S%H6381><s%> ve-nif-le-'o-Tav, and [for] his wonderful works לִבְנֵ֥י <S%H1121><s%> liv-Nei to the children אָדָֽם׃ <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam. of men

וִֽ֭ירֹמְמוּהוּ <S%H7311><s%> Vi-ro-me-mu-hu Let them exalt בִּקְהַל־ <S%H6951><s%> bik-hal- him also in the congregation עָ֑ם <S%H5971><s%> 'Am; of the people וּבְמוֹשַׁ֖ב <S%H4186><s%> u-ve-mo-Shav him in the assembly זְקֵנִ֣ים <S%H2205><s%> ze-ke-Nim of the elders יְהַלְלֽוּהוּ׃ <S%H1984><s%> ye-hal-Lu-hu. and praise

יָשֵׂ֣ם <S%H7760><s%> ya-Sem He turneth נְהָר֣וֹת <S%H5104><s%> ne-ha-Rot rivers לְמִדְבָּ֑ר <S%H4057><s%> le-mid-Bar; into a wilderness וּמֹצָ֥אֵי <S%H4161><s%> u-mo-Tza-'ei and springs מַ֝֗יִם <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim, of water לְצִמָּאֽוֹן׃ <S%H6774><s%> le-tzim-ma-'on. into dry ground

אֶ֣רֶץ <S%H776><s%> 'E-retz land פְּ֭רִי <S%H6529><s%> Pe-ri A fruitful לִמְלֵחָ֑ה <S%H4420><s%> lim-le-Chah; into barrenness מֵ֝רָעַ֗ת <S%H7451><s%> me-ra-'At, for the wickedness יֹ֣שְׁבֵי <S%H3427><s%> Yo-she-vei of them that dwell בָֽהּ׃ Vah.

יָשֵׂ֣ם <S%H7760><s%> ya-Sem He turneth מִ֭דְבָּר <S%H4057><s%> Mid-bor the wilderness לַֽאֲגַם־ <S%H98><s%> la-'a-gam- into a standing מַ֑יִם <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim; water וְאֶ֥רֶץ <S%H776><s%> ve-'E-retz ground צִ֝יָּ֗ה <S%H6723><s%> tzi-Yah, and dry לְמֹצָ֥אֵי <S%H4161><s%> le-mo-Tza-'ei springs מָֽיִם׃ <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim. of water

וַיּ֣וֹשֶׁב <S%H3427><s%> vai-Yoo-shev to dwell שָׁ֣ם <S%H8033><s%> sham and there רְעֵבִ֑ים <S%H7457><s%> re-'e-Vim; And there he maketh the hungry וַ֝יְכוֹנְנ֗וּ <S%H3559><s%> vay-chon-Nu, that they may prepare עִ֣יר <S%H5892><s%> 'ir a city מוֹשָֽׁב׃ <S%H4186><s%> mo-Shav. for habitation

וַיִּזְרְע֣וּ <S%H2232><s%> vai-yiz-re-'U And sow שָׂ֭דוֹת <S%H7704><s%> dot the fields וַיִּטְּע֣וּ <S%H5193><s%> vai-yit-te-'U and plant כְרָמִ֑ים <S%H3754><s%> che-ra-Mim; vineyards וַ֝יַּעֲשׂ֗וּ <S%H6213><s%> vai-ya-'a-Su, which may yield פְּרִ֣י <S%H6529><s%> pe-Ri fruits תְבֽוּאָה׃ <S%H8393><s%> te-Vu-'ah. of increase
